content.description: Climb just left of the right edge of the cliff's north side, aiming for the colorful rock at the top, where you'll be right on the arete. Fun movement, good position. Mixed gear and bolts.
content.protection: Mixed gear and bolts, chain anchor.
content.location: Right side of the cliff's north face.

climbs.name: Mama Macs
climbs.fa: Zoe Hallowell, Cheyenne Stirling, Emily Wolfe 2017

content.description:
Start just right of a small tree and boulder up off the ground. Follow easier ground, which turns into 5.10 climbing, and then a crimpy crux by the bolt at the top. Mixed gear and bolts. Overall good climbing and cleaner than it looks.

There is another set of bolts/hangers directly above the main crack system (if you go up instead of doing the left-trending crux at the top). This final 20 foot-section is cleaned and ready for someone to send it. Might need another bolt.
content.protection: A few bolts and a chain anchor. Single set of cams from red C3 to #2 Camalot. A second #2 is helpful to place in the shallow horizontal in the runout at the bottom.

content.description: Left leaning hand and finger crack. Fun climbing, but dirty and short.
content.location: Obvious left-leaning crack on the left side of the cliff's north face.
